location_details: Incident started with crossing from Bulgaria to Serbia, detention in 'Belnanwaz detention center' in Belgrade, transfer to Serbia-Bulgaria border near Pirot, apprehension and mistreatment in Pirot outskirts, forced return to Bulgaria.
where_clear: Serbia-Bulgaria border area, including Pirot and Belgrade in Serbia.
location_text_raw: Bulgaria to Serbia, Belnanwaz detention center in Belgrade, Serbia-Bulgaria border, Pirot city in Serbia, Pirot outskirts, Bulgaria.
uncertainty_note: The Fundamental Rights Office cannot establish with certainty that the alleged incidents occurred. Serbian authorities state no detention center named 'Belnanwaz' exists and could not confirm the incident.
evidence_quote: During a screening interview performed by Frontex, a screened person stated that a group of 20 nationals, including himself, was detained for ten days in Serbia. After that, on 15/02/2024 the group was allegedly transferred to the Serbia-Bulgaria border, where the Serbian police confiscated their belongings, forced them to remove their clothes, and ordered them to cross to Bulgaria.
context_note: A group of 20 migrants, including the interviewee, was allegedly detained in Serbia from 2024-02-04, transferred to the Serbia-Bulgaria border on 2024-02-15, stripped of belongings, and ordered to cross to Bulgaria. The interviewee was later apprehended near Pirot on 2024-02-16, physically mistreated by Serbian police, and again forced to return to Bulgaria. The Fundamental Rights Office notes the Serbian authorities' inability to confirm the incident or the existence of the mentioned detention center.

location_details: Migrant boat in distress south of Lesvos in Greek territorial waters, near coordinates 38.887833, 26.446500. Later identified off the coast of İzmir's Karaburun district after rescue by Turkish Coast Guard. Also mentioned as 'deep inside Greek waters, southeast of Plomari, Lesvos south' and 'Lesvos island inside Turkish TTW'.
where_clear: South of Lesvos island, Aegean Sea
location_text_raw: south of Lesvos in Greek territorial waters, additional coordinates (38.887833, 26.446500), off the coast of İzmir's Karaburun district, Lesvos island inside Turkish TTW, in pos 38° 48' 00" N 026° 26' 18" E, Lesvos island inside Turkish TTW, in pos 38° 46' 24" N, 026° 26' 18" E, deep inside Greek waters, southeast of Plomari, Lesvos south, 8.35 km distance from the shoreline of Lesvos, in the area Lesvos
evidence_quote: On 19/02/2024, the Fundamental Rights Office received information from an NGO about a migrant boat in distress south of Lesvos along with videos taken by the migrants. The videos showed a blue patrol vessel in the vicinity and a seemingly black inflatable boat with two persons on board close to the migrant boat. The Fundamental Rights Office identified the migrant group in photographs taken during a rescue by the Turkish Coast Guard on 19/02/2024.
context_note: Migrant boat in distress with approximately 50 migrants on board. Allegedly towed to Turkish waters by Hellenic Coast Guard, engine destroyed, and phones confiscated. A Frontex vessel (Bulgarian asset) was confirmed to be in the vicinity. Migrants were eventually rescued by the Turkish Coast Guard.

location_details: South of Lesvos in Greek territorial waters, near coordinates 38.887833, 26.446500. Other reported locations for potentially matching incidents include Lesvos island inside Turkish TTW at 38.8, 26.438333 and 38.773333, 26.438333, and southeast of Plomari, Lesvos south, 8.35 km from shoreline.
location_text_raw: south of Lesvos in Greek territorial waters ... additional coordinates (38.887833, 26.446500)
country_or_area: Lesvos island, Aegean Sea, Greece/Turkey maritime border
uncertainty_note: Multiple slightly different coordinates and descriptions are provided for the same incident, all in the general area south of Lesvos, near the Greek/Turkish maritime border. The chosen coordinates are from the NGO's initial report.
evidence_quote: On 19/02/2024, the Fundamental Rights Office received information from an NGO about a migrant boat in distress south of Lesvos along with videos taken by the migrants. The same day, the NGO posted on X and Facebook additional coordinates (38.887833, 26.446500).
context_note: A migrant boat with approximately 50 individuals (men, women, several children) was in distress. A Frontex vessel (Bulgarian asset) was identified in the vicinity. Allegations by an NGO include the Hellenic Coast Guard towing the migrant boat to Turkish waters, destroying its engine, and confiscating phones. The FRO notes that the alleged modus operandi is consistent with previously highlighted HCG practices.

location_details: A group of ten migrants, starting from Belgrade, Serbia, were transported by Serbian police from a reception centre south of Belgrade to a shallow river near Dimitrovgrad, at the Serbian-Bulgarian border, and forced to cross into Bulgaria. They were subsequently apprehended by Bulgarian police in a village territory in Bulgaria, near the border.
location_text_raw: at the [REDACTED] in Bulgaria, public park in Belgrade, reception centre located 1.5-hour drive south of Belgrade, after passing Dimitrovgrad, the van reached a shallow river, what migrants assumed to be by the border with Bulgaria, territory of the village of [REDACTED] found and arrested ten persons without documents, location of the apprehension in Bulgaria [REDACTED] from the border with Serbia)
uncertainty_note: Specific river name and village in Bulgaria are redacted.
evidence_quote: The Fundamental Rights Office concludes as likely that a group of ten migrants was apprehended by the Serbian police in Serbia, transported from the reception centre to the border with Bulgaria, and subsequently forced to cross the border.
context_note: A group of ten migrants was apprehended by Serbian police in Serbia, transported from a reception centre to the Serbian-Bulgarian border near Dimitrovgrad, and allegedly subjected to ill-treatment, theft of phones/documents, and forced collective expulsion into Bulgaria. They were subsequently apprehended by Bulgarian police.

where_clear: Reception and Identification Centre (RIC) in Greece
uncertainty_note: Specific Reception and Identification Centre (RIC) not identified, but context (Hellenic Police intervention, Operation Poseidon) strongly indicates Greece.
evidence_quote: On 19.11.2017 at approx. a protest took place in RIC . The riot started close to the minors Section and it was provoked by few Arabic speaking migrants. ... The Anti-Riot Unit of the HP intervened in order to re-establish the public order. ... No information about injured people during the incident.
context_note: A riot occurred in a Reception and Identification Centre (RIC), provoked by Arabic-speaking migrants. Equipment of NGOs and UNHCR was damaged. The Hellenic Police (HP) intervened to restore public order. No Frontex staff were involved, and no injured people were reported.

uncertainty_note: Location details are redacted in the document.
evidence_quote: one of the had been hospitalized
context_note: A Frontex surveillance aircraft mission was reduced because one person was hospitalized. The incident was reported by ICC Poseidon Sea. The hospitalization led to a reduction in workforce. No indication that the illness was connected to Frontex activities or facilities, and no identified impact.

location_details: A white fiberglass boat with over 30 migrants was detected by Frontex aerial surveillance, initially in the Libyan SRR, then updated to the Maltese SRR. A Libyan vessel performed the rescue, during which violence against migrants was observed.
where_clear: Maltese Search and Rescue Region (SRR), near Libyan SRR
location_text_raw: inside the Libyan Search and Rescue Region (SRR)
uncertainty_note: The exact point within the SRR is not specified, only that it was within the Maltese SRR after initially being reported in the Libyan SRR.
evidence_quote: Frontex unmanned aerial aircraft detected a white fiberglass boat with over 30 migrants onboard, inside the Libyan Search and Rescue Region (SRR) according to initial estimates. [...] Frontex surveillance aircraft updated the position of the boat in the Maltese SRR and reported a Libyan vessel performing the rescue of the migrants. Frontex surveillance aircraft observed [...] instances of violence against two (2) migrants by at least three (3) crew members of the Libyan vessel
context_note: Frontex unmanned aerial aircraft detected a migrant boat, initially in Libyan SRR, then updated to Maltese SRR. A Libyan vessel performed a rescue, during which violence against two migrants by at least three crew members was observed.
